author: kfogel
msg: * README: Document the documentation better.  Thanks to David Summers
for pointing out the problems.

author: blair
msg: Tons of changes.  I imported 38 revisions of a unversioned source code
package dating from August 2000 for the company using this script!
* tools/client-side/svn_load_dirs.pl:
Set `svn:executable' to `on'.
Set `svn:keywords' to `LastChangedBy LastChangedDate LastChangedRevision'
and use them.  Remove $VERSION.
Formatting changes.
(main):
Add a new command line option, -property_cfg_filename or -p for
short, which lists a configuration file containing regular
expressions to match against added files and directories along
with the property name and value propset to the new file or
directory.
Work around a bug in svn where files with mixed end of lines that
have the svn:eol-style property set to `native' cannot be
checked in (see issue #851).  The work-around, determine the
native eol on the system and then convert all CR, CRLF and LF's
in the input file to the native eol.  New variable %upd_files to
keep track of updated files.
Pass -b to diff when any file with a `native' svn:eol-style is
updated or added in the repository or ignore end of line
differences.
Pass -u to diff when comparing the input and tagged directory to
make easier identification of problem differences.
Use $ENV{TMPDIR} to find a temporary directory instead of
hardwiring /tmp.  Default to /tmp if TMPDIR is not set.
Fix a bug where a tag directory was created when it should not
have been if the tag directory contained only one segment.
Save IO by only copy files from the input directory if the digest
hash of the input and file already existing in the repository
differ.
(determine_native_eol): New subroutine to determine the native eol
on the system by writing \n to an empty file in non-binary mode
and reading the file back in binary mode.
(convert_file_to_native_eol): New subroutine to convert all CR, CRLF
and LF's in the specified file to the native eol style.
(split_line): New subroutine to split a line of input into words
taking into account that single or double quotes may define a
single word with whitespace in it.  Used by the configuration file
reader for the new -property_cfg_filename command line option.
(usage): Update usage for -property_cfg_filename.
(die_when_called): Not used, so delete it.
(recursive_ls_and_hash): Rename from recusurive_ls_and_hash, which
misspelled recursive.
* tools/client-side/svn_load_dirs.README:
Add documentation for the property setting feature of
svn_load_dirs.pl.
* doc/handbook/client.texi:
Add documentation for the property setting feature of
svn_load_dirs.pl.

author: blair
msg: Documentation cleanup and enhancements.
* doc/handbook/svn-handbook.texi:
Add INFO-DIR-SECTION and INFO-DIR-ENTRY so these documents can be
registered with the info index.  Patch from David Kimdon
<dwhedon@debian.org>.
* doc/handbook/best_practices.texi:
Add comment on how to generate an initial log message using the
output of svn status.
Use our texi conventions.
* doc/programmer/design/svn-design.texi:
Add INFO-DIR-SECTION and INFO-DIR-ENTRY so these documents can be
registered with the info index.  Patch from David Kimdon
<dwhedon@debian.org>.

author: kfogel
msg: * CHANGES: Bring up-to-date in preparation for interim release.

author: kfogel
msg: Resolve issue #855, with Mike Pilato:
* subversion/libsvn_client/externals.c
(handle_external_item_change): Request a tree lock, since we're
removing the tree.
* subversion/tests/clients/cmdline/module_tests.py
(update_lose_external): Fix comment.
(test_list): Run the test again, now that it passes.
Unrelated fix:
* subversion/libsvn_wc/adm_ops.c
(svn_wc_remove_from_revision_control): Be more careful about
removing entry from parent dir.
